TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {21364=Document Type: Procurement Plan Report No.: 77135 Document Date: APR 01, 2013, 7922=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: Document Date: MAR 01, 2011, 12290=The development objective of the St. Petersburg Economic Development Loan Project is to: 1) policy and regulatory environment is conducive to the expansion of private sector enterprises; 2) larger and more efficient private market for land and real estate; 3) improved city fiscal management capacity; 4) city to preserve its comparative advantage in culture and the arts. ... See More + This extension is necessary to ensure completion of stage two of the reconstruction of the east wing of the state hermitage museum which is currently underway and estimated to cost US$231,200,000 equivalent. The borrower is co-financing 90 percent of the contract with the remaining 10 percent provided under the loan. Stage two of the state hermitage east wing reconstruction is estimated to take 25 months and was initially scheduled for completion by end June 2012. This restructuring paper extends the closing date of the project from July 1, 2012 to December 31, 2013. This will be the second and final extension of the closing date for the project.  See Less -, 20421=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR7965 Document Date: DEC 26, 2012, 16480=The objective of the St. Petersburg Economic Development Loan Project for Russian Federation is to: a) policy and regulatory environment is conducive to the expansion of private sector enterprises, b) larger and more efficient private market for land and real estate, c) improved city fiscal management capacity, and d) city to preserve its comparative advantage in culture and the arts. ... See More + The changes include the reallocation of the loan proceeds and the increase in the share of the Borrowers co-financing under category one: (a) works under part A of the project for the State Hermitage Museum and for phase two of rehabilitation of two Corp-de Gardes in the Mikhailovsky palace of the State Russian Museum. The changes were requested by the Russian Deputy Minister of Finance Mr. Storchak on November 12, 2012 and are necessary to cover the financing gap arising from exchange rate fluctuations between the US$ in which the loan is denominated, and the Russian Ruble denominated Hermitage East Wing reconstruction contract.  See Less -, 15201=Document Type: Project Paper Report No.: 74375 Document Date: DEC 11, 2012, 11009=Document Type: Project Paper Report No.: 62702 Document Date: JUN 14, 2011, 6909=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: Document Date: SEP 25, 2010, 25371=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR17382 Document Date: DEC 08, 2014, 6003=Document Type: Project Information Document Report No.: AB4358 Document Date: DEC 10, 2008, 469=Document Type: Project Appraisal Document Report No.: 25550 Document Date: APR 15, 2003, 17332=Document Type: Project Paper Report No.: 74375 Document Date: DEC 12, 2012, 2826=Document Type: Loan Agreement Report No.: Document Date: AUG 04, 2004, 13234=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: Document Date: AUG 17, 2011, 18607=The objective of the St. Petersburg Economic Development Loan Project for Russian Federation is to: a) policy and regulatory environment is conducive to the expansion of private sector enterprises, b) larger and more efficient private market for land and real estate, c) improved city fiscal management capacity, and d) city to preserve its comparative advantage in culture and the arts. ... See More + The changes include the reallocation of the loan proceeds and the increase in the share of the Borrowers co-financing under category one: (a) works under part A of the project for the State Hermitage Museum and for phase two of rehabilitation of two Corp-de Gardes in the Mikhailovsky palace of the State Russian Museum. The changes were requested by the Russian Deputy Minister of Finance Mr. Storchak on November 12, 2012 and are necessary to cover the financing gap arising from exchange rate fluctuations between the US$ in which the loan is denominated, and the Russian Ruble denominated Hermitage East Wing reconstruction contract.  See Less -, 22282=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR11105 Document Date: JUN 25, 2013, 10150=The development objective of the St. Petersburg Economic Development Loan Project is to: 1) policy and regulatory environment is conducive to the expansion of private sector enterprises; 2) larger and more efficient private market for land and real estate; 3) improved city fiscal management capacity; 4) city to preserve its comparative advantage in culture and the arts. ... See More + This extension is necessary to ensure completion of stage two of the reconstruction of the east wing of the state hermitage museum which is currently underway and estimated to cost US$231,200,000 equivalent. The borrower is co-financing 90 percent of the contract with the remaining 10 percent provided under the loan. Stage two of the state hermitage east wing reconstruction is estimated to take 25 months and was initially scheduled for completion by end June 2012. This restructuring paper extends the closing date of the project from July 1, 2012 to December 31, 2013. This will be the second and final extension of the closing date for the project.  See Less -, 3592=Document Type: Project Paper Report No.: 49013 Document Date: JUN 25, 2007, 23316=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR11928 Document Date: DEC 27, 2013, 26383=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR19791 Document Date: JUN 16, 2015, 14254=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR6128 Document Date: APR 11, 2012, 19521=Document Type: Agreement Report No.: Document Date: DEC 13, 2012, 24337=Document Type: Implementation Status and Results Report Report No.: ISR14902 Document Date: JUN 05, 2014}

textBeforeTable: See More + Document Type: Project Appraisal Document Report No.: 25550 Document Date: APR 15, 2003 The St. Petersburg Economic Development Loan (SPB-EDL) for the Russian Federation will support the City in its efforts to accelerate the implementation of key elements of the Strategic Plan, which was designed to enhance the citys prospects for sustainable economic growth in the medium- and longer term, and allow it to more fully exploit its position as Russias Window to the West. ... See More + To this end, SPB-EDL will contribute to: (a) improving the business climate in St. Petersburg by facilitating the creation of new private sector enterprises, increasing private ownership and transactions of land and real estate, and improving land use planning; (b) strengthening the Citys financial management and ensuring the long-term stability of its fiscal revenue base; and (c) enabling St. Petersburg to preserve its unique position as one of Russias top centers of culture and the arts through the rehabilitation of key cultural heritage and tourism assets. An additional indirect, yet strategically important goal pursued by the Bank through preparing SPB-EDL, is to develop and test a model of Bank operation in support of structural reform at sub-national level that, in the future, could be replicated elsewhere in Russia or other ECA
